thread.title: Kiefer Ravena breaks silence, parries photo scandal
thread.title_full: Kiefer Ravena breaks silence, parries photo scandal

title: Kiefer Ravena breaks silence, parries photo scandal
text: Kiefer Ravena breaks silence, parries photo scandal (philstar.com)  36pm Kiefer Ravena of the Philippines soars for a layup in one of his many national team stints. | FIBA.com Photo MANILA, Philippines – Former collegiate superstar Kiefer Ravena has a handful of things to worry about. And all of those are about basketball. Speaking for the first time since the firestorm off his alleged leaked photographs, Ravena said his focus remains on the "task at hand." In an interview with ABS-CBN Sports’ Camille Naredo , the former UAAP Most Valuable Player remained unfazed by the circulating images that purportedly involve him in a graphic exchange. Ravena, who has been based in Texas in the past months, is currently serving as a "developmental player" for the Texas Legends—the NBA D-League affiliate of the Dallas Mavericks. The versatile guard is back at home to reinforce Alab Pilipinas in the Asean Basketball League playoffs, which will start on April 2. "I'm just trying to get that championship back to the Philippines for the ABL," he said. Ravena recently lent his services to Mighty Sports in Dubai along with longtime buddy Jeron Teng. He is again reunited with another in Alab skipper Bobby Ray Parks Jr. Alab Pilipinas, which holds the No. 3 spot in the Asian tourney, will take on the No. 2 Singapore Slingers for a spot in the Finals.
